meanings.def: a small flat round piece of medicine that you swallow whole, without biting it
examples: Take three pills daily after meals.
(informal) pill-popping (= the act of taking too many pills or using illegal drugs)
The doctor prescribed her some pills to help her sleep.
I was on various pills for my heart condition.

meanings.def: a pill that some women take to prevent them becoming pregnant
examples: on the pill to be/go on the pill
Her doctor put her on the pill at 16.

meanings.def: a fact or an event that is unpleasant and difficult to accept
examples: The election defeat was a bitter pill for the party to swallow.

meanings.def: to do something that makes an unpleasant situation seem less unpleasant

idioms.def: a fact or an event that is unpleasant and difficult to accept
examples: The election defeat was a bitter pill for the party to swallow.

idioms.def: to do something that makes an unpleasant situation seem less unpleasant

meanings.def: to become covered in very small balls of fibre
